instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board that had liquid damage around the 3v42 area and some other areas around the cpu by the fan connector.
I replaced all the components in those areas and I get a light on the charger now but for some reason <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was only around 3v. I ended up realizing that g3h was shorted to ground in diode mode and when I removed L7130 the short was only on Pin 2 side so I tracked it down to a couple of capacitors that were next to the cpu. I put the coil on and still no change in voltage on ppbus g3h.  I checked again and saw that L7130 was shorted to ground and when I removed it the short was gone for some reason. 
I put two more L7130s from donor boards and each time I put them on the short appears.

This is something I haven't seen before so do you know what else could be causing this. I already replaced F7140 and that measures fine.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
What do you mean shorted to ground?

With L7130 removed, is the short on Pin 1 or Pin 2 on the board?
Resistance to ground in Ohms?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
In diode mode with L7130 on the board I am getting 0.004 to ground. With it removed the diode mode readings are normal.  Before tracking down and fixing the short previously I was getting 0v to ground on Pin 2 of L7130. 
Now its normal and the short only appears when I put L7130 on the board.
I will have to check the resistance in the morning.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: Please explain to me how L7130 can short PPBUS to GND, hint....it can't.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Okay I checked again this morning and there was no short. I'm thinking all the heat on the board was messing up my measurements.

Anyways, now I get 8.59v on ppbus but I am not getting voltages on other rails.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulses initially at 5v then just stays at 1.71v. I have 0v and no pulses on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. There are discolered probe points around the bios chip and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> but the components all look good.

Also, I replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and the current sense resistors yesterday.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
It was not heat, it is residual charge in the capacitors....

Check the usual corrosion points, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> first. CPU Vcore also pulsing?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: No Cpu vcore is not pulsing.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulse?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
No pulse on <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>. 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> isn't pulsing at 5v anymore and instead it just shows a steady 1.7v.

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>? That should always be there, or do you mean S4? If S5 is missing check corrosion around <CHIP>TPS51580</CHIP>.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Yes <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is the one thats 1.7v
I cleaned the board a few days ago but I don't believe there was corrosion around the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> chip and all the probe points look pretty good around it.

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> voltages
Pin 4: 0v
Pin 12: 3.43v
Pin 21: 3.43v
Pin 23: 8.59v

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> getting warm? Resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>? 3V LDO working on pin 22? Sure trace to pin 23 is not corroded?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> is around 1.7MegaOhms. Diode Mode shows 0.44v
Trace is good on Pin 23 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.
3.31v on Pin 22 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
I did feel <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> getting slightly warm so I replaced it and still I get the same measurements as before.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Only thing <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> needs to generate <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> is VIN to pin23 and enable to pin 12. 
Inject 5V on <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> and see what current draw it has. Also feel if anything connected to <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> heats up.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Okay I injected 5v and I got 1.09amp draw and <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> got very hot again.
Do you think it is the chip again or something else causing it do that? The end of the capacitor on <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> came off after I took the wire off of it after injecting voltage so I'm going to need to replace that as well.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: Replace <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and try again.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: I replaced <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> and still I only get 1.72v on Pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR>. I am getting 8.58v on Pin 23 and 3.42v on pin 12 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: Is it getting hot?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
No it is not getting hot when I had the charger plugged in. 
When I removed charger and injected voltage on Pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> got really hot at 5v and even around 3v.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: Checked for short on L7520/60? VREF2, VREG3 present?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Pin 13(VREF2) is at 1.99v
Pin 22(VREG3) is at 3.32v
There is no short on L7520 or L7560 either.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
Anything else I should check on this?
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: I have no idea really. The 5V is usually used inside the regulator to drive the output FETs so maybe a bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>/7560 may cause issues. Replace them both including <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> again.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message:
replaced all 3 and I still get 1.7v on <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.  
I will just have to send this back to the customer.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground with coil put on
threads.message: I am out of ideas too then.
